comments:
In a Java Entity if you edit the name of an attribute by just typing in the source code you get the following exception:

java.lang.NullPointerException 
at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.content.java.JavaPersistentAttribute.includes(JavaPersistentAttribute.java:520) 
at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.content.java.JavaPersistentType.contentNodeAt(JavaPersistentType.java:782) 
at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.content.java.JpaCompilationUnit.getContentNode(JpaCompilationUnit.java:345) 
at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.JpaFile.getContentNode(JpaFile.java:330) 
at org.eclipse.jpt.ui.internal.selection.TextEditorSelectionParticipant.calculateSelection(TextEditorSelectionParticipant.java:88) 
at org.eclipse.jpt.ui.internal.selection.TextEditorSelectionParticipant.editorSelectionChanged(TextEditorSelectionParticipant.java:64) 
at org.eclipse.jpt.ui.internal.selection.TextEditorSelectionParticipant.access$2(TextEditorSelectionParticipant.java:63) 
at org.eclipse.jpt.ui.internal.selection.TextEditorSelectionParticipant$EditorSelectionListener.selectionChanged(TextEditorSelectionParticipant.java:166) 
at org.eclipse.jface.text.TextViewer.firePostSelectionChanged(TextViewer.java:2533) 
at org.eclipse.jface.text.TextViewer.firePostSelectionChanged(TextViewer.java:2485)
fixed for M7, for now it selects the persistentType in the structure instead of getting an NPE.  bug 136183 can be used to track any remaining progress on this issue
